Constructor

new(X : Float, Y : Float, W : Float, H : Float, LineStyle_ : flixel.util.LineStyle, FillStyle_ : flixel.util.FillStyle)
parameters
X x position of the canvas
Y y position of the canvas
Width
Height
LineStyle_
FillStyle_
Creates a FlxSprite with a circle drawn on top of it. X/Y is where the SPRITE is, the circle's upper-left

Instance Variables hide inherited show inherited

ID : Int

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
IDs seem like they could be pretty useful, huh? They're not actually used for anything yet though.

acceleration(default,null) : flixel.util.FlxPoint

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
How fast the speed of this object is changing (in pixels per second). Useful for smooth movement and gravity.

active(default,accessor) : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
Controls whether update() is automatically called by FlxState/FlxGroup.

alive(default,accessor) : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
Useful state for many game objects - "dead" (!alive) vs alive. kill() and revive() both flip this switch (along with exists, but you can override that).

allowCollisions : Int

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
Bit field of flags (use with UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT, etc) indicating collision directions. Use bitwise operators to check the values stored here. Useful for things like one-way platforms (e.g. allowCollisions = UP;). The accessor "solid" just flips this variable between NONE and ANY.

alpha(default,accessor) : Float

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
Set alpha to a number between 0 and 1 to change the opacity of the sprite.

angle(default,accessor) : Float

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
Set the angle of a sprite to rotate it. WARNING: rotating sprites decreases rendering performance for this sprite by a factor of 10x (in Flash target)!

angularAcceleration : Float

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
How fast the spin speed should change (in degrees per second).

angularDrag : Float

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
Like drag but for spinning.

angularVelocity : Float

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
This is how fast you want this sprite to spin (in degrees per second).

animation : flixel.animation.FlxAnimationController

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
Class that handles adding and playing animations on this sprite.

antialiasing : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
Controls whether the object is smoothed when rotated, affects performance.

bakedRotationAngle(default,null) : Float

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
The minimum angle (out of 360°) for which a new baked rotation exists. Example: 90 means there are 4 baked rotations in the spritesheet. 0 if this sprite does not have any baked rotations.

blend(default,accessor) : flash.display.BlendMode

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
Blending modes, just like Photoshop or whatever, e.g. "multiply", "screen", etc.

cachedGraphics(default,accessor) : flixel.util.loaders.CachedGraphics

inherited from flixel.FlxObject

cameras : Array<FlxCamera>

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
This determines on which FlxCameras this object will be drawn - by default, it uses FlxG.cameras.list), which means it is drawn on all existing cameras.

collisionType(default,null) : flixel.system.FlxCollisionType

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
Enum that informs the collision system which type of object this is (to avoid expensive type casting).

collisonXDrag : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
Whether this sprite is dragged along with the horizontal movement of objects it collides with (makes sense for horizontally-moving platforms in platformers for example).

color(default,accessor) : Int

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
Tints the whole sprite to a color (0xRRGGBB format) - similar to OpenGL vertex colors. You can use 0xAARRGGBB colors, but the alpha value will simply be ignored. To change the opacity use alpha.

colorTransform(accessor,null) : flash.geom.ColorTransform

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite

debugBoundingBoxColor(default,accessor) : Int

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
Overriding this will force a specific color to be used for debug rect.

dirty : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
Set this flag to true to force the sprite to update during the draw() call. NOTE: Rarely if ever necessary, most sprite operations will flip this flag automatically.

drag(default,null) : flixel.util.FlxPoint

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
This isn't drag exactly, more like deceleration that is only applied when acceleration is not affecting the sprite.

elasticity : Float

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
The bounciness of this object. Only affects collisions. Default value is 0, or "not bouncy at all."

exists(default,accessor) : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
This flag indicates whether this objects has been destroyed or not. Cannot be set, use destroy() and revive().

facing(default,accessor) : Int

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
Set facing using FlxObject.LEFT,RIGHT, UP, and DOWN to take advantage of flipped sprites and/or just track player orientation more easily.

fillStyle(default,accessor) : flixel.util.FillStyle

inherited from flixel.addons.display.shapes.FlxShape

flipped(default,null) : Int

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
If the Sprite is flipped.

forceComplexRender(default,accessor) : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
Whether the object should use complex render on flash target (which uses draw() method) or not. WARNING: setting forceComplexRender to true decreases rendering performance for this object by a factor of 10x!

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
The actual Flash BitmapData object representing the current display state of the sprite.

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
The total number of frames in this image. WARNING: assumes each row in the sprite sheet is full!

inherited from flixel.addons.display.shapes.FlxShape

mass : Float

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
The virtual mass of the object. Default value is 1. Currently only used with elasticity during collision resolution. Change at your own risk; effects seem crazy unpredictable so far!

maxAngular : Float

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
Use in conjunction with angularAcceleration for fluid spin speed control.

maxVelocity(default,null) : flixel.util.FlxPoint

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
If you are using acceleration, you can use maxVelocity with it to cap the speed automatically (very useful!).

moves(default,accessor) : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
Set this to false if you want to skip the automatic motion/movement stuff (see updateMotion()). FlxObject and FlxSprite default to true. FlxText, FlxTileblock and FlxTilemap default to false.

offset(default,null) : flixel.util.FlxPoint

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
Controls the position of the sprite's hitbox. Likely needs to be adjusted after changing a sprite's width, height or scale.

origin(default,null) : flixel.util.FlxPoint

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
WARNING: The origin of the sprite will default to its center. If you change this, the visuals and the collisions will likely be pretty out-of-sync if you do any rotation.

pixels(accessor,accessor) : flash.display.BitmapData

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
Set pixels to any BitmapData object. Automatically adjust graphic size and render helpers.

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
Rendering variables.

scale(default,null) : flixel.util.FlxPoint

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
Change the size of your sprite's graphic. NOTE: The hitbox is not automatically adjusted, use updateHitbox for that (or setGraphicSize(). WARNING: scaling sprites decreases rendering performance by a factor of about x10!

scrollFactor(default,null) : flixel.util.FlxPoint

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
Controls how much this object is affected by camera scrolling. 0 = no movement (e.g. a background layer), 1 = same movement speed as the foreground. Default value is (1,1), except for UI elements like FlxButton where it's (0,0).

solid(accessor,accessor) : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
Whether the object collides or not. For more control over what directions the object will collide from, use collision constants (like LEFT, FLOOR, etc) to set the value of allowCollisions directly.

touching : Int

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
Bit field of flags (use with UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT, etc) indicating surface contacts. Use bitwise operators to check the values stored here, or use isTouching(), justTouched(), etc. You can even use them broadly as boolean values if you're feeling saucy!

useColorTransform(default,null) : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
Whether or not to use a colorTransform set via setColorTransform.

velocity(default,null) : flixel.util.FlxPoint

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
The basic speed of this object (in pixels per second).

visible(default,accessor) : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
Controls whether draw() is automatically called by FlxState/FlxGroup.

wasTouching : Int

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
Bit field of flags (use with UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT, etc) indicating surface contacts from the previous game loop step. Use bitwise operators to check the values stored here, or use isTouching(), justTouched(), etc. You can even use them broadly as boolean values if you're feeling saucy!

inherited from flixel.FlxObject

returns
The Point you passed in, or a new Point if you didn't pass one, containing the screen X and Y position of this object.

hurt(Damage : Float) : Void

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
parameters
Damage How much health to take away (use a negative number to give a health bonus).
Reduces the "health" variable of this sprite by the amount specified in Damage. Calls kill() if health drops to or below zero.

inline inWorldBounds() : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
returns
Whether the object is within the Worldbounds or not.
Check and see if this object is currently within the Worldbounds - useful for killing objects that get too far away.

isOnScreen(?Camera : FlxCamera) : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
parameters
Camera Specify which game camera you want. If null getScreenXY() will just grab the first global camera.
returns
Whether the object is on screen or not.
Check and see if this object is currently on screen. Differs from FlxObject's implementation in that it takes the actual graphic into account, not just the hitbox or bounding box or whatever.

isSimpleRender() : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
Checks if the Sprite is being rendered in "simple mode" (via copyPixels). True for flash when no angle, bakedRotations, scaling or blend modes are used. This enables the sprite to be rendered much faster if true.

inline isTouching(Direction : Int) : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
parameters
Direction Any of the collision flags (e.g. LEFT, FLOOR, etc).
returns
Whether the object is touching an object in (any of) the specified direction(s) this frame.
Handy function for checking if this object is touching a particular surface.

inline justTouched(Direction : Int) : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
parameters
Direction Any of the collision flags (e.g. LEFT, FLOOR, etc).
returns
Whether the object just landed on (any of) the specified surface(s) this frame.
Handy function for checking if this object is just landed on a particular surface.

kill() : Void

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
Handy function for "killing" game objects. Use reset() to revive them. Default behavior is to flag them as nonexistent AND dead. However, if you want the "corpse" to remain in the game, like to animate an effect or whatever, you should override this, setting only alive to false, and leaving exists true.

loadGraphic(Graphic : Dynamic, ?Animated : Bool, ?Reverse : Bool, ?Width : Int, ?Height : Int, ?Unique : Bool, ?Key : String) : FlxSprite

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
parameters
Graphic The image you want to use.
Animated Whether the Graphic parameter is a single sprite or a row of sprites.
Reverse Whether you need this class to generate horizontally flipped versions of the animation frames.
Width Optional, specify the width of your sprite (helps FlxSprite figure out what to do with non-square sprites or sprite sheets).
Height Optional, specify the height of your sprite (helps FlxSprite figure out what to do with non-square sprites or sprite sheets).
Unique Optional, whether the graphic should be a unique instance in the graphics cache. Default is false.
Key Optional, set this parameter if you're loading BitmapData.
returns
This FlxSprite instance (nice for chaining stuff together, if you're into that).
Load an image from an embedded graphic file.

loadGraphicFromSprite(Sprite : FlxSprite) : FlxSprite

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
parameters
Sprite The FlxSprite from which you want to load graphic data
returns
This FlxSprite instance (nice for chaining stuff together, if you're into that).
Load graphic from another FlxSprite and copy its tileSheet data. This method can useful for non-flash targets (and is used by the FlxTrail effect).

loadGraphicFromTexture(Data : Dynamic, ?Reverse : Bool, ?Unique : Bool, ?FrameName : String) : FlxSprite

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
parameters
Data Atlas data holding links to json-data and atlas image
Reverse Whether you need this class to generate horizontally flipped versions of the animation frames.
Unique Optional, whether the graphic should be a unique instance in the graphics cache. Default is false.
FrameName Default frame to show. If null then will be used first available frame.
returns
This FlxSprite instance (nice for chaining stuff together, if you're into that).
Loads TexturePacker atlas.

loadRotatedGraphic(Graphic : Dynamic, ?Rotations : Int, ?Frame : Int, ?AntiAliasing : Bool, ?AutoBuffer : Bool, ?Key : String) : FlxSprite

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
parameters
Graphic The image you want to rotate and stamp.
Rotations The number of rotation frames the final sprite should have. For small sprites this can be quite a large number (360 even) without any problems.
Frame If the Graphic has a single row of square animation frames on it, you can specify which of the frames you want to use here. Default is -1, or "use whole graphic."
AntiAliasing Whether to use high quality rotations when creating the graphic. Default is false.
AutoBuffer Whether to automatically increase the image size to accomodate rotated corners. Default is false. Will create frames that are 150% larger on each axis than the original frame or graphic.
Key Optional, set this parameter if you're loading BitmapData.
returns
This FlxSprite instance (nice for chaining stuff together, if you're into that).
Create a pre-rotated sprite sheet from a simple sprite. This can make a huge difference in graphical performance!

loadRotatedGraphicFromTexture(Data : Dynamic, Image : String, ?Rotations : Int, ?AntiAliasing : Bool, ?AutoBuffer : Bool) : FlxSprite

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
parameters
Data Atlas data holding links to json-data and atlas image
Image The image from atlas you want to rotate and stamp.
Rotations The number of rotation frames the final sprite should have. For small sprites this can be quite a large number (360 even) without any problems.
AntiAliasing Whether to use high quality rotations when creating the graphic. Default is false.
AutoBuffer Whether to automatically increase the image size to accomodate rotated corners.
returns
This FlxSprite instance (nice for chaining stuff together, if you're into that).
Creates a pre-rotated sprite sheet from provided image in atlas. This can make a huge difference in graphical performance on flash target!

makeGraphic(Width : Int, Height : Int, ?Color : Int, ?Unique : Bool, ?Key : String) : FlxSprite

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
parameters
Width The width of the sprite you want to generate.
Height The height of the sprite you want to generate.
Color Specifies the color of the generated block (ARGB format).
Unique Whether the graphic should be a unique instance in the graphics cache. Default is false.
Key Optional parameter - specify a string key to identify this graphic in the cache. Trumps Unique flag.
returns
This FlxSprite instance (nice for chaining stuff together, if you're into that).
This function creates a flat colored square image dynamically.

overlaps(ObjectOrGroup : FlxBasic, ?InScreenSpace : Bool, ?Camera : FlxCamera) : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
parameters
ObjectOrGroup The object or group being tested.
InScreenSpace Whether to take scroll factors into account when checking for overlap. Default is false, or "only compare in world space."
Camera Specify which game camera you want. If null getScreenXY() will just grab the first global camera.
returns
Whether or not the two objects overlap.
Checks to see if some FlxObject overlaps this FlxObject or FlxGroup. If the group has a LOT of things in it, it might be faster to use FlxG.overlaps(). WARNING: Currently tilemaps do NOT support screen space overlap checks!

overlapsAt(X : Float, Y : Float, ObjectOrGroup : FlxBasic, ?InScreenSpace : Bool, ?Camera : FlxCamera) : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
parameters
X The X position you want to check. Pretends this object (the caller, not the parameter) is located here.
Y The Y position you want to check. Pretends this object (the caller, not the parameter) is located here.
ObjectOrGroup The object or group being tested.
InScreenSpace Whether to take scroll factors into account when checking for overlap. Default is false, or "only compare in world space."
Camera Specify which game camera you want. If null getScreenXY() will just grab the first global camera.
returns
Whether or not the two objects overlap.
Checks to see if this FlxObject were located at the given position, would it overlap the FlxObject or FlxGroup? This is distinct from overlapsPoint(), which just checks that point, rather than taking the object's size into account. WARNING: Currently tilemaps do NOT support screen space overlap checks!

overlapsPoint(point : flixel.util.FlxPoint, ?InScreenSpace : Bool, ?Camera : FlxCamera) : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxObject
parameters
Point The point in world space you want to check.
InScreenSpace Whether to take scroll factors into account when checking for overlap.
Camera Specify which game camera you want. If null getScreenXY() will just grab the first global camera.
returns
Whether or not the point overlaps this object.
Checks to see if a point in 2D world space overlaps this FlxObject object.

pixelsOverlapPoint(point : flixel.util.FlxPoint, ?Mask : Int, ?Camera : FlxCamera) : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
parameters
Point The point in world space you want to check.
Mask Used in the pixel hit test to determine what counts as solid.
Camera Specify which game camera you want. If null getScreenXY() will just grab the first global camera.
returns
Whether or not the point overlaps this object.
Checks to see if a point in 2D world space overlaps this FlxSprite object's current displayed pixels. This check is ALWAYS made in screen space, and always takes scroll factors into account.

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
Helper function for reseting precalculated FlxFrame bitmapdatas. Useful when _pixels bitmapdata changes (e.g. after stamp(), FlxSpriteUtil.drawLine() and other similar method calls).

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite

inline resetSizeFromFrame() : Void

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
Resets sprite's size back to frame size

revive() : Void

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
Handy function for bringing game objects "back to life". Just sets alive and exists back to true. In practice, this function is most often called by FlxObject.reset().

setColorTransform(?redMultiplier : Float, ?greenMultiplier : Float, ?blueMultiplier : Float, ?alphaMultiplier : Float, ?redOffset : Float, ?greenOffset : Float, ?blueOffset : Float, ?alphaOffset : Float) : Void

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
parameters
redMultiplier The value for the red multiplier, in the range from 0 to 1.
greenMultiplier The value for the green multiplier, in the range from 0 to 1.
blueMultiplier The value for the blue multiplier, in the range from 0 to 1.
alphaMultiplier The value for the alpha transparency multiplier, in the range from 0 to 1.
redOffset The offset value for the red color channel, in the range from -255 to 255.
greenOffset The offset value for the green color channel, in the range from -255 to 255.
blueOffset The offset for the blue color channel value, in the range from -255 to 255.
alphaOffset The offset for alpha transparency channel value, in the range from -255 to 255.
Set sprite's color transformation with control over color offsets. Works only on flash target

setGraphicSize(?Width : Int, ?Height : Int) : Void

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
parameters
Width How wide the graphic should be. If <= 0, and a Height is set, the aspect ratio will be kept.
Height How high the graphic should be. If <= 0, and a Width is set, the aspect ratio will be kept.
Helper function to set the graphic's dimensions by using scale, allowing you to keep the current aspect ratio should one of the Integers be <= 0. It might make sense to call updateHitbox() afterwards!

inline setOriginToCenter() : Void

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
Sets the sprite's origin to its center - useful after adjusting scale to make sure rotations work as expected.

update() : Void

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite

updateFrameData() : Void

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
Use this method for creating tileSheet for FlxSprite. Must be called after makeGraphic(), loadGraphic or loadRotatedGraphic(). If you forget to call it then you will not see this FlxSprite on c++ target

updateHitbox() : Void

inherited from flixel.FlxSprite
Updates the sprite's hitbox (width, height, offset) according to the current scale. Also calls setOriginToCenter(). Called by setGraphicSize().
